name: poult
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a young chicken, turkey, or other bird that is kept for food: The turkeys produce an average of about 3.4 poults per hen. Many of the pheasant poults do not survive.
More examplesFewer examplesGame farmers find that young poults will peck each other aggressively.Blue grouse - especially hens and their clutch of poults - normally stay in this part of the breeding range.Wild turkey poults mature quickly and at 16 weeks they are nearly adult size.He denied that the company imported turkey poults (chicks) or feed from abroad.
